bioshift.core.spectrum module¶

class bioshift.core.spectrum.Spectrum(params: SpectrumParams, data_source: SpectrumDataSource)¶

Bases: object

NMR spectrum object.

data_source¶

Object responsible for loading spectrum data from disk.

Type:

bioshift.fileio.spectrumdatasource.SpectrumDataSource

params¶

Object containing spectrum metadata.

Type:

bioshift.core.spectrumparams.SpectrumParams

Properties:

data: N-dimensional numpy array containing the raw spectrum. ndim: Number of dimensions of the spectrum.

coord_to_shift(coord: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]]) → ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]]¶

Convert array index coordinates to chemical shifts.

Parameters:

shift – N-dimensional spectrum coordinates vector.

Returns:

N-dimensional chemical shift vector.

property data: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]]¶
data_source: SpectrumDataSource¶
property ndim: int¶
params: SpectrumParams¶
shift_to_coord(shift: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]]) → ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]]¶

Convert chemical shift to array index coordinates.

Parameters:

shift – N-dimensional chemical shift vector.

Returns:

N-dimensional spectrum coordinates vector.

class bioshift.core.spectrumparams.SpectrumParams(ndim: int, shape: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[int]], block_shape: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[int]], n_blocks: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[int]], nuclei: tuple[NMRNucleus], transform: SpectrumTransform, header_size: int = 0)¶

Bases: object

Contains spectrum metadata used to interpret the raw array of data.

ndim¶

Number of dimensions of the spectrum.

Type:

int

shape¶

Number of data points along each axis.

Type:

numpy.ndarray[tuple[Any, …], numpy.dtype[int]]

block_shape¶

Number of data points along each axis per block.

Type:

numpy.ndarray[tuple[Any, …], numpy.dtype[int]]

n_blocks¶

Number of blocks along each axis.

Type:

numpy.ndarray[tuple[Any, …], numpy.dtype[int]]

transform¶

Transformation object which maps array coordinates to chemical shifts.

Type:

bioshift.core.spectrumtransform.SpectrumTransform

header_size¶

Size of the binary data file header in bytes.

Type:

int

block_shape: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[int]]¶
property block_volume: int¶
header_size: int = 0¶
n_blocks: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[int]]¶
ndim: int¶
nuclei: tuple[NMRNucleus]¶

bioshift.core.spectrumreference module¶

class bioshift.core.spectrumreference.SpectrumReference(spectrum_shape: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]], spectral_width: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]], spectrometer_frequency: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]], ref_coord: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]], ref_ppm: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]])¶

Bases: object

Contains the referencing information required to create the spectrum transform.

spectrum_shape¶

Number of data points along each axis of the spectrum.

Type:

numpy.ndarray[tuple[Any, …], numpy.dtype[numpy._typing._array_like._ScalarT]]

spectral_width¶

Width of the spectrum along each axis in Hz.

Type:

numpy.ndarray[tuple[Any, …], numpy.dtype[numpy._typing._array_like._ScalarT]]

spectrometer_frequency¶

Frequency of the spectrometer along each axis in MHz.

Type:

numpy.ndarray[tuple[Any, …], numpy.dtype[numpy._typing._array_like._ScalarT]]

ref_coord¶

Array index coordinate vector of the reference point.

Type:

numpy.ndarray[tuple[Any, …], numpy.dtype[numpy._typing._array_like._ScalarT]]

ref_ppm¶

Chemical shift vector of the reference point.

Type:

numpy.ndarray[tuple[Any, …], numpy.dtype[numpy._typing._array_like._ScalarT]]

ref_coord: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]]¶
ref_ppm: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]]¶
spectral_width: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]]¶
spectrometer_frequency: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]]¶
spectrum_shape: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]]¶
transform() → SpectrumTransform¶

Transform object derived from the referencing information. Uses linear relationship between spectrum coordinates and chemical shifts to determine the scaling and offset of the transformation.

Returns:

SpectrumTransform object corresponding to provided spectrum referencing.

bioshift.core.spectrumtransform module¶

class bioshift.core.spectrumtransform.SpectrumTransform(scaling, offset)¶

Bases: object

Represents a diagonal affine transformation used to map between coordinates in the raw spectrum array and chemical shift values.

scaling¶

Vector of scaling factors for each axis.

Type:

numpy.ndarray[tuple[Any, …], numpy.dtype[numpy._typing._array_like._ScalarT]]

offset¶

Offset vector.

Type:

numpy.ndarray[tuple[Any, …], numpy.dtype[numpy._typing._array_like._ScalarT]]

Properties:

inverse: The inverse of the transform.

apply(point: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]]) → ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]]¶

Apply the transformation to a point.

Returns:

Transformed point as a vector.

Raises:

ValueError – If the shapes of the input point and the transform do not match.

property inverse¶
offset: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]]¶
scaling: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]]¶
property shape¶
